description: Shorelight partners with top-ranked, nonprofit U.S. universities to attract and support international students. The company delivers high-touch, technology-driven enrollment and student success services. Enables global diversity on U.S. campuses by managing recruitment, admissions support, language preparation, and persistence services. Works on a shared-revenue model with universities. A leader in the international student marketplace, aiming to “Educate the World” by enhancing access, integration, and outcomes for non-U.S. students.

projects.name: Shorelight University Portal
projects.description: A comprehensive portal for universities to manage international student enrollment, admissions, and support services. The portal integrates with Salesforce for CRM functionalities and Contentful for content management.

projects.name: Shorelight's Admission Portal
projects.description: An admissions portal that streamlines the application process for international students, providing features like application tracking, document submission, and communication with admissions staff.

projects.name: Shorelight's UI Components Library
projects.description: A universal library of UI components built with React.js and Material UI, designed to ensure consistency and reusability across all Shorelight applications.

projects.name: Multi Factor Authentication Service
projects.description: Implemented a secure multi-factor authentication service to enhance the security of user accounts across Shorelight's platforms.

projects.name: Shorelight's Student Marketplace
projects.description: A marketplace platform for students to access various services, resources, and opportunities available through Shorelight and its partner universities.

achievements: Led architectural design for the company’s new Marketplace platform, promoting reusability and scalability across micro-frontends.
Spearheaded MFA integration with AWS and Okta, enhancing security for the admissions portal.
Established frontend unit testing standards, creating documentation and improving code quality across teams.
